properties.address: Marton Methodist Chapel, High St, Marton, Gainsborough, Lincolnshire DN21 5AA
properties.description: We have a table tennis table, cards, dominoes and similar games. Offering free hot and cold drinks, and light refreshments. A variety of books to borrow, colouring/ writing materials for younger children, table space for doing homework. Everyone welcome!
properties.title: Marton Methodist Chapel

properties.description: The Chapter House is down the ramp from church. Tuesdays 10am - 12pm is our places of welcome cafe, and 2pm - 4pm is our Craft Circle group. All are welcome to join or simply to come and have a drink or some soup. We also have free coats available for all.
properties.title: St Michael's Church - Chapter House

properties.description: Open from 22-11-22. All are welcome. Quiet area. Study Space. Information/advice area. Games for Children.

properties.description: Community coffee morning, open to everyone at no cost to the attendee. This is a weekly event, every Friday 10am - 12pm - starting on Friday 11th November, and then every Friday. The venue is accessible to all. Cost: No Cost
properties.title: Bassetlaw Hospice

properties.description: The building will be freely available during cafe opening times. No booking is necessary, however, seating is split over 2 floors, with limited space on the ground floor. Each Friday between 10am and 12pm they have a chatty cafe, for people to be able Cost: N/A

properties.address: Hallcroft Methodist Church, Hallcroft Road DN22 7LB
properties.description: Keep warm with a cup of tea or coffee. No charge. Donations can be made. No need to book. Car park at the front of the building. Access is to the side of the building. Ramp at the entrance. Inside everything is on one level. Accessible toilets Cost: Donations accepted
properties.title: Hallcroft Methodist Church

properties.description: Community Coffee Morning every Friday morning. Open to everyone. Free to attend- no booking necessary. Every Friday at 10am. Some of the Coffee Mornings are themed to make them fun and interesting. Cost: N/A
properties.title: Bassetlaw Hospice Support & Wellbeing Centre

properties.contact: The Well Reception - Telephone 01777 702344 or email admin@thewellrbc.org
properties.description: Everyone is welcome but all children under 16 must be accompanied by an adult. There's no need to book - just turn up and it's free. We have plenty of parking. There's no charge but any donations towards the cost of providing the warm snack will be gratefully received. Warm snack provideed from 5-7pm. Quiet and Study area are available. For those who are interested, there will be a varied programme of things to do and also an opportunity to get some debt and budgeting advice. There is a lift in the main building. Please note: All children under the age of 16 must be accompanied. Cost: Donations accepted
properties.title: The Well

properties.description: Drop in between 9:00 a.m. and 12:00 noon every Thursday morning. Keep warm with a cup of tea or coffee. Advisory leaflets available. No charge. No need to book. Accessible toilets, ramp into the building, baby changing facilities. Please enter through the glass doors which can be seen from the church car park on Union Street. Cost: No Charge
properties.title: Grove Street Methodist Church

properties.address: ST Nicholas Church, Lincoln Road NG22 0HR
properties.description: A mixture of activities including crafts, board games, toddler play space with toys, free tea and coffee and a chance to natter. A job coach is available with notice. Soup and a snack available between 12.15pm and 1pm- Tea, Coffee and biscuits available all morning - Wednesday from 9th November - 9.30am - 1.00pm - and then every Wednesday. No charge. The event is known as Meeting Place. Although it is held within a Church, it is a non-religious activity. Fully accessible including a toilet and baby change. Cost: No Charge
properties.title: St Nicholas Church

properties.address: Beeches Community Centre, Birch Court NG22 0NG
properties.description: Starting on Monday 14th November, at 11am and then every Monday. No booking required, just come along. Small car park available. Disabled access and Baby Changing Facilities. Cost: N/A
properties.title: Tuxford Town Council and Community Events

properties.address: All Hallows’ Church, Church Lane, Ordsall DN22 7TP
properties.contact: Contact Name: Alex Shiells Contact Email: vicar@owrchurches.co.uk Contact Phone Number: 07561049232
properties.description: Coffee Morning from 10am to 12pm every Wednesday, followed by our Craft Circle craft group from 2pm to 4pm. Church is open, the heating is on and all are welcome to pop in at any time and have tea, coffee, biscuits or a cup-a-soup and bread roll. All are welcome and it’s always free! The building is accessible but the church is at the top of the hill on church lane. The easiest way to get to the church is to park in the spaces at the top of church lane, or to walk up the lane from High Street. Cost: No Charge
properties.title: All Hallows’ Church

properties.address: St Michael's Church, Rectory Road DN22 7AY
properties.contact: Contact Name: Alex Shiells Contact Email: vicar@owrchurches.co.uk Contact Phone Number: 07561049232
properties.description: The Chapter House down the ramp from the entrance to St Michael's Church on the corner of Bridgegate and Rectory Road is open every Tuesday for our Places of Welcome cafe. All are welcome to join us for tea, coffee and soup. We also have a Community Coat Rail and anyone is welcome to take a coat, no questions asked. Every Tuesday afternoon we also have our Craft Circle craft group taking place in the chapter house. (2pm - 4pm). Come for a chat, bring a craft project if you'd like to, and refreshments are available throughout. Not taking place between Christmas Day and New Year's Day. Cost: No Charge
properties.title: St Michael's Church
